channel.title: Timer
channel.description: Hi, I can't seem to work out how i would set a timer for the server to message all players a certain text that i input. If anyone could help me with the coding i'd be extremely grateful. Thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 31, 2008, 08:43:51 pm[/size][hr]Anyone?

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Timer
TimerTask

Example Usage:

Key:
Blue: Comments.
Red: Key words.
Brown: Initialized variables.
Navy: Class names.
Maroon: Instance names, variables and methods.
Green: Implement methods.

int delay = 5000; // delay for 5 sec after start up. int period = 60000; // repeat every 1 min. Timer timer = new Timer(); 
timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() {
        public void run() {
            // Add your code.
        }
}, delay, period);</blockquote>

Edit:
Oh, remember the times are in milliseconds.

1 second = 1000 milliseconds
10 seconds = 10 000 milliseconds
100 seconds = 100 000 milliseconds

and so on…

Millisecond calculator

Read full topic

item.description:
@Noob.Coder wrote:

That’s the same problem I’ve been having with my own server. I think I’m doing the codes right but my server can’t process them. I think it might have something to do with either client.java, or server.java. I hope you get helped with!
